show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A cheerful celebration with themed games, props & singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

show.title: Wicked
show.headline: Defy gravity with the effervescent first chapter of the mega-hit musical

event.title: <show-title>Wicked</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Defy gravity at our interactive, magically fun screening
event.description:
Did you know that real magic actually exists? It’s easy to find if you know where to look, namely at our absolutely magical WICKED Movie Party!

Grab your fellow witches and wizards and join us at Shiz University (i.e., your local Alamo Drafthouse) for an unforgettable screening that will make you feel like defying gravity. There’ll be singing, green-tinted glasses, pink bubbles, Shiz University notebooks, and even broom pens (in case you need to make a quick getaway).

So if you’re popular, like dancing through life, and are ready for some fun at dear old Shiz, then don’t miss this wickedly good Movie Party.

event.headline: Bring your whole wayfaring crew to a family movie party
event.description: Enter the world of Oceania at our MOANA 2 Family Party, with themed props and interactive activities for your whole wayfaring crew. Your ticket to the movie includes a conch shell noise maker necklace, a Heihei-inspired popping eye keychain, glow bracelets, and a Kakamora craft with sticker sheet. Dress up as your favorite MOANA character and get ready to set sail.

show.title: Gremlins
show.headline: Your favorite little monsters invade Christmas, yet again

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wreak havoc mogwai-style at a fun, interactive screening
event.description:
Need another reason to love Christmas? Then look no further than the adorably devious yuletide creature feature GREMLINS! Joe Dante’s iconic holiday misadventure continues to be a pop culture sensation, with its darkly funny story of a small-town guy who receives a furry little creature called a mogwai that ends up multiplying into a swarm of monsters that rip the town to shreds. Frankly, wanton destruction has never been so fun.

At our GREMLINS Movie Party, we won’t let you tear the place apart or ruin our electronics, but we will have all kinds of fun props available to help you get in on the action, including 3D specs you can use to get a new perspective on SNOW WHITE, light-up necklaces, and masks so you can choose #TeamSpike or #TeamGizmo.

We just ask that you follow these few simple rules:

  • Don’t get a mogwai wet.
  • Don’t expose a mogwai to bright light.
  • Don’t feed a mogwai after midnight.
  • Don’t miss our GREMLINS Movie Party.

titleCardImage.altText: Movie Party TC

show.title: In a Lonely Place
show.headline: Humphrey Bogart stars in a noir classic of suspicion, intrigue, and suspense

event.title: <show-title>In a Lonely Place</show-title>
event.headline: Bogart breaks hearts (and noses) in Nicholas Ray’s devastating Hollywood noir
event.description:
We’re all writing the version of ourselves we want people to see. But sometimes, we write ourselves into a corner. It’s “noir season” here at Queer Film Theory 101; as the nights grow longer and the shadows loom large, we’re in the mood for something a bit tormented. In Nicholas Ray’s IN A LONELY PLACE, loosely adapted from Dorothy Hughes's novel, struggling screenwriter Dixon Steele (Humphrey Bogart) is suspected of murder after a brief encounter with a young woman who has turned up dead. Dix’s violent temperament and outsider tendencies certainly fit the “prime suspect” archetype, but he’s got an alibi: his beautiful new neighbor Laurel Gray (Gloria Graham) witnessed the encounter. What follows is a torrid romance that forces Dix and Laurel to question what they know about themselves, and what they’re willing to sacrifice for love and desire.

But is it queer you ask? Absolutely. First off, the protagonist's name is Dix Steele… Bogart’s coldly masculine loner screams repressed homosexuality. The gender roles in IN A LONELY PLACE are consistently in flux, with Steele more often exhibiting the unhinged and manipulative traits of a “femme fatale” rather than the '50s leading man. This twisted noir unpacks the lies that grow between men and women, the falseness of identity in Hollywood, and the darkness that takes hold when we begin to believe the worst of each other and ourselves. WHEW! Something tells us we’re going to need a stiff drink and a long look in the mirror after this torrid classic. Welcome to Hollywood, kid, hope you survive the experience.

event.title: <show-title>A Real Pain</show-title> <event-type-title>Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: See Jesse Eisenberg's cathartic dramedy before anyone else
event.description: You want to talk about pain? How about the pain of missing out on seeing one of this year’s most poignant, heartfelt, and impressive dramedies? That’s very real and can be avoided entirely by booking tickets for our Early Access Screening of Jesse Eisenberg’s A REAL PAIN. With an unforgettable performance from Kieran Culkin that is a heavy awards season contender, this is one you’ll want to see as early as possible.

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

And this party is a real beaut, with yuletide props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glow sticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: The Polar Express
show.headline: Journey beyond your imagination in this holiday family favorite

event.title: <show-title>The Polar Express</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: All aboard for an interactive holiday adventure the whole family will love
event.description:
Tickets, please. You can’t attend THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party without your ticket. And believe us when we tell you that the conductor (one of many Tom Hankses in this movie) is very particular about it.

Once you and the kiddos come aboard this special holiday movie party, we’ll have all sorts of fun surprises waiting for you, including kid-friendly props like a Santa hat, sleigh bells, and some fun activity sheets for you to take home. (And don’t worry, parents, we’ll be sure to lay down some ground rules so you’re not having to listen to jingle bells the whole time.)

With fun props, tasty treats, and more Tom Hankses than you can shake a candy cane at, THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party is a delightful, interactive holiday activity the whole family will love.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: OMAR AND CEDRIC: IF THIS EVER GETS WEIRD

portraitHeroImage.altText: OMAR AND CEDRIC: IF THIS EVER GETS WEIRD

posterImages.altText: OMAR AND CEDRIC: IF THIS EVER GETS WEIRD

show.title: Querelle
show.headline: Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s last and most controversial film

event.title: <show-title>Querelle</show-title>
event.headline: Sex, drugs, and murder abound in Fassbender’s luridly erotic maritime swan song
event.description:
It’s the end of 2024 and Queer Film Theory 101 is going out with bang! While we typically explore films that strictly feature queer subtext, we decided to close out the year with some hardcore overt bisexual cinema from dearly departed queer auteur Rainer Werner Fassbender.

In his final film, QUERELLE, Fassbender releases the hounds of desire and deviance on France! Belgian sailor George Querelle (Brad Davis) arrives in the port of Brest (I mean… come on) aboard the cargo ship Le Vengeur with an appetite for sex, crime, and murder. And then he does those things. That’s the plot. Films aren’t always super complicated. Fassbender’s subversive and grimy adaptation of Jean Genet’s equally controversial novel Querelle of Brest toes the line between exploitation and arthouse with a smattering of Tom of Finland and pulp thrown in the mix, and we love every filthy minute of it. This underseen queer erotic classic has never looked better after a recent digital restoration approved by the director of photography Xaver Schwarzenberger and we can’t wait to experience all of the debaucheries on the big screen with you. Batten down the hatches sailor, there’s a big bisexual storm a-brewin’.

show.title: Black Christmas (1974)
show.headline: Bob Clark's immortal holiday slasher, recently restored

event.title: <show-title>Black Christmas (1974)</show-title>
event.headline: The 4K restoration of the immortal holiday classic
event.description: We don't just watch horror movies — we live for them. And at every Terror Tuesday, we join hands to worship at the gore-soaked altar of slash, trash, thrash, and FUN!! This eclectic series spans all centuries, covering everything from seminal horror treasures to undiscovered D.I.Y. monster-blasts. Terror Tuesday is the new ground zero for warming your black heart.

show.title: Inside (2007)
show.headline: Extreme season’s greetings from France

event.title: <show-title>Inside (2007)</show-title>
event.headline: Extreme season’s greetings from France
event.description: A standout from the 2000s “New French Extremity” wave, INSIDE is a brutal, chilling, and riveting holiday horror experience. Sarah (the intense Alysson Paradis) is a pregnant widow who just wants a quiet night at home on Christmas Eve. But a mysterious figure outside the snow-swept house has other plans. A remarkably layered examination of anxiety that’s strengthened by home invasion thrills, INSIDE is a stylish, gore-soaked nightmare that you won’t soon forget. Joyeux noël!

show.title: Jaws: The Revenge
show.headline: A Great White in the Bahamas is an easy way to ruin Christmas.

event.title: <show-title>Jaws: The Revenge</show-title>
event.headline: A Great White in the Bahamas is an easy way to ruin Christmas.
event.description:
After a recent Great White attack claims the life of her youngest son at Christmas, a recently-widowed Ellen Brody jets down the Bahamas where her other son, now a marine biologist, is on the verge of a scientific breakthrough. Great timing, as the same shark from New England has now emerged in the Caribbean to enact its own set of vengeance.

The beauty of JAWS: THE REVENGE lies in its absurdity and dream logic - a sequel to one of the most successful and satisfying pop delights of all-time now feels like its own Italian knock-off. Where else can one witness a woman of a certain age try to get her groove back with Michael Caine while locking into a psychic battle with a shark holding a vendetta against her entire family? That's a Christmas gift that we all deserve. (Jake Isgar)

4k DCP courtesy of Universal Pictures.

show.title: Southbound
show.headline: Five intertwining tales of terror unfold along an endless desert highway

event.title: <show-title>Southbound</show-title>
event.headline: All paths converge on the highway to hell!
event.description: On a desolate stretch of desert highway, weary travelers – two men on the run from their past, a band on their way to the next gig, a man struggling to get home, a brother in search of his long-lost sister, and a family on vacation – are forced to confront their worst fears and darkest secrets in these interwoven tales of terror and remorse on the open road. (MPI Media)

show.title: V/H/S/2
show.headline: Who's tracking you?

event.title: <show-title>V/H/S/2</show-title>
event.headline: The found footage anthology sensation
event.description:
Searching for a missing student, two private investigators break into his abandoned house and find another collection of mysterious VHS tapes. In viewing the horrific contents of each cassette, they realize there may be terrifying motives behind the student’s disappearance. Featuring segments directed by Adam Wingard & Simon Barrett, (THE GUEST), Jason Eisener (HOBO WITH A SHOTGUN), Timo Tjahjanto & Gareth Evans (THE RAID), and Eduardo Sánchez & Gregg Hale (THE BLAIR WITCH PROJECT).

DCP courtesy of Magnolia Pictures & Magnet Releasing

show.title: XX
show.headline: An all female horror anthology

event.title: <show-title>XX</show-title>
event.headline: Four deadly tales from four female filmmakers
event.description:
We wrap up our month-long spotlight on anthology films with the all-femme rager XX. Featuring the combined talents of Roxanne Benjamin (SOUTHBOUND, V/H/S/2), Annie Clark aka St. Vincent, Karyn Kusama (THE INVITATION), and Jovanka Vuckovic, these bite-sized horror blasts deliver a smorgasbord of genre delights.

DCP courtesy of Magnolia Pictures and Magnet Releasing

show.title: The Conversation
show.headline: A stunning new 4K restoration of Coppola's classic paranoid thriller.

show.title: Birth
show.headline: Nicole Kidman's most adventurous role to-date

event.title: <show-title>Birth</show-title>
event.headline: Nicole Kidman's most adventurous role to-date
event.description:
Ten years after her husband suddenly died, Anna (Nicole Kidman) has finally restarted her life and accepted a marriage proposal from her boyfriend. At the engagement party, a stranger wanders in to announce that he's Anna's dead husband. That stranger is a ten-year-old boy. Against her better judgment, Anna decides to hear him out.

Arguably the apex of a stretch of roles proving her to be the most adventurous movie star of her generation, Nicole Kidman gives a pitch-perfect performance in the chilly world Jonathan Glazer creates in BIRTH. (Mike Keegan)

35mm print courtesy of Park Circus

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Blood Feast
show.headline: The first-ever splatter film from genre movie maverick Herschell Gordon Lewis

event.title: <show-title>Blood Feast</show-title>
event.headline: H.G. Lewis' immortal splatterfest.
event.description:
The filmography of genre movie maverick Herschell Gordon Lewis brimmed with the mad, macabre, and just downright bizarre. One of the most unhinged of all his directorial efforts – and certainly the most influential – is his original gore-fest BLOOD FEAST, the first-ever splatter film.

Dorothy Fremont is looking to throw a party unlike any other, and she gets just that when the decidedly sinister Fuad Ramses caters the event. Promising to provide her guests with an authentic Egyptian feast, Ramses promptly acquires the necessary ingredients: the body parts of young nubiles.

Featuring a host of stomach-churning gore gags including the infamous “tongue” sequence, BLOOD FEAST more than lives up to its name and remains essential viewing for any self-respecting horror fan. (AGFA)

eventType.title: Special Event

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: Phase IV
show.headline: Welcome your new insect overlords!

event.title: <show-title>Phase IV</show-title>
event.headline: Welcome your new insect overlords!
event.description:
PHASE IV is prolific designer Saul Bass’ sole feature film as director, and its classic status stands as a testament to his talent. When ants begin to build unusual structures in the Arizona desert, a team of scientists set up a research station to try and learn more about this sudden change in insect behavior. A masterclass in tone and balancing ambiguity, speculative fiction, and science-fact, PHASE IV is an eerie experience that dips into cosmic horror and existential philosophy. Incredible macro photography of actual ants and Bass’ eye for design make this an event not to be missed on the big screen.

DCP courtesy of Paramount Pictures

show.title: Runaway Train
show.headline: The only Cannon movie written by Akira Kurosawa!

event.title: <show-title>Runaway Train</show-title>
event.headline: The only Cannon movie written by Akira Kurosawa!
event.description:
This Cannon produced thrill-ride will grab a hold of your nerves and won’t let up until credits roll!

When Manny (Jon Voight) and Buck (Eric Roberts) escape from an Alaska prison in the midst of deep winter, making their way across a freezing rizer, they think they’re in luck when they manage to board a train. Things go horribly wrong when the railroad engineer suddenly dies, and the two find they are on an out of control vehicle, all the while being pursued by the cruel warden dead-set on capturing them.

event.description: Order from our tasty brunch menu – Breakfast Club, Blueberry Donut French Toast Bake, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Coming Up Rosé Fizz. Each is available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

show.title: Silent Night, Deadly Night
show.headline: The infamous 1980s Santa slasher returns

event.title: <show-title>Silent Night, Deadly Night</show-title>
event.headline: The infamous 1980s Santa slasher returns
event.description: Santa Claus is coming to town...and this time, he’s got an axe! Community leaders tried to stop it. The PTA fought to ban it. Now, one of the most controversial slasher films of all time is back in a new restoration from the original camera negative. SILENT NIGHT, DEADLY NIGHT is the demented story of little Billy Chapman, traumatized by his parents’ Christmas Eve murder and then brutalized by sadistic nuns in an orphanage. When Billy grows up and dresses as Santa, he goes on a yuletide rampage to punish the naughty with extreme prejudice. Robert Brian Wilson and Linnea Quigley (NIGHT OF THE DEMONS) star in this harrowing horror classic that continues to ruffle the feathers of angry parents and stuffy critics 40 years later.

show.title: Space Is the Place
show.headline: Delivers Bay Area afro-futurism in the '70s.

posterImages.altText: Space is the place lobby poster

event.title: <show-title>Space Is the Place</show-title>
event.headline: Sun Ra delivers a dose of afro-futurist acid jazz in this 4K Restoration.
event.description:
Screening as a part of WEIRD SF - a monthly celebration of Bay Area oddities co-presented by Amoeba Music, with pre-screening DJ set in Bear vs. Bull.

Spurring from his frequent lectures in the late '60s at UC-Berkeley, Sun Ra hits the big screen with a touch of the power cosmic in SPACE IS THE PLACE.

Sun Ra and his Arkestra return to Earth after several years in space. Ra proclaims himself “the alter-destiny”, meets with inner-city youths and battles with the devil himself to save his fellow man in this afro-futurist dose of acid jazz that plays like a mix between THE DAY THE EARTH STOOD STILL, THE SEVENTH SEAL, and DOLEMITE. (Jake Isgar)

show.title: Trancers
show.headline: The Battle for the Future has begun.

event.title: <show-title>Trancers</show-title>
event.headline: The Battle for the Future has begun.
event.description:
Tim Thomerson is Jack Deth, the kind of cop who says “I’ve got your warrant right here,” always with a cigarette dangling from his mouth, and a trench coat with maximum shoulder padding as only could have been imagined in the decade they were lost in. Time-traveling out of a neon and slime soaked future Los Angeles, Deth must jump into the body of a distant ancestor in order to stop baddy Martin Whistler, who turns people into oozing zombies to carry out his evil plan. As luck would have it, he turns up in the bed of his relative’s girlfriend (Helen Hunt, foxy as a punk girl), and convinces her to help him out. Trancers can’t hide from him, not even when disguised as a mall Santa Claus! Don’t be a squid - treat yourself to a fun time at the movies!

DCP courtesy of Full Moon Studios.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
